Or, in general, that the attackers (traditionally fowards and midfielders) need to play defense when they don't have the ball, and the defenders need to be able to start the attack.  Due to their field positions, they will do them in different ways, but they are a team that must attack together and defend together.

-------------- Original message -------------- 
From: "Ilja Preuss" <preuss@...> 
> Perhaps a good analogy would be a basketball forward who thinks, "I
> don't really need to work on my dribbling, the guards always bring up
> the ball."

Or (for us Europeans ;) like a goalkeeper thinking "I don't need to
communicate with the defenders, I'll just catch every ball they let
through."

Cheers, Ilja
